intro: Nothaphoebe angustifolia, commonly known as the narrowleaf nothaphoebe, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of southern China, particularly in Yunnan Province. The plant is characterized by its narrow, elongated leaves that are typically arranged alternately along the stems. It produces small, clustered flowers that are usually greenish-white in color, followed by small, round berries. Nothaphoebe angustifolia is often found in humid, shaded environments within evergreen forests.
